channel.title: Ubuntu Font Problem
channel.description: Hello my Ubuntu font is really weird. Well its readable and that but its just really small and all text and everything is really small too, the text and words are around this big > , < i was wondering where can i chnage it to a larger, more easier to read and use font for the whole system? Is this possible at all? Thanks, sorry if i didn't explain to well =/ But i would be very happy if anyone could help me =)

item.title: Ubuntu Font Problem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Thanks Ron, it worked a treat

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Font Problem
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Click on System > Preferences > Font to change the font.

You can change the rendering, the font type, and the font size. I think the default size is 10 so try 12 or 14 if 10 isn’t big enough.

Read full topic
